ELEMENTS OF LEETCODE - Python solutions explained

Solutions/answers to Leetcode questions in Python and C++. For information about the project see the section About The Project.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Bit Manipulation:

  • Knowledge base
    • Bitwise operators
      • &, AND
      • |, OR
      • ^, XOR
      • ~, NOT
      • <<, >>, shift
    • Functions, methods for numeric types
    • Common tasks
      • Count bits
      • +, - 1
      • Even and odd numbers
      • Zero pad
      • Use binaries verbatim
      • Extract LSBs
      • Merge
    • Vocabulary
      • MSB, LSB
      • Sign bit
      • Masks
  • Part 1 (1-9)
    • 1. Hamming weight
    • 2. Compute the parity of a word
    • 3. Swap bits
    • 4. (LC190) Reverse bits
    • 5. Find a closest integer with the same weight
    • 6. Compute x**y
    • 7. Reverse digits
    • 8. Check if a decimal integer is a palindrome
    • 9. Add without using +
  • Part 2 (10-19)
    • 10. Binary gap
    • 11. Get, set, clear one bit
    • 12. Count flips to convert
    • 13. Find difference
    • 14. Find missing number
    • 15. Flip bit longest sequence
    • 16. Alternating bits
    • 17. Insert bit
    • 18. (LC 231) Power of two
    • 19. Remove bit
  • Part 3 (20-29)
    • 20. Reverse bits
    • 21. Single number
    • 22. Single number2
    • 23. Single number3
    • 24. (LC 401) Binary Watch
    • 25. Bitwise AND of-numbers-range
    • 26. (LC 461) Hamming distance
    • 27. (LC 477) Total Hamming Distance
    • 28. Maximum-product-of-word-lengths
    • 29. (LC 421) Maximum XOR of Two Numbers in an Array
  • Part 4 (30-36)
    • 30. (LC 462) Minimum Moves to Equal Array Elements II
    • 31. (LC 1573) Number of Ways to Split a String
    • 32. (LC 342) Power of Four
    • 33. (LC 762) Prime Number of Set Bits in Binary Representation
    • 34. (LC 645) Set Mismatch
    • 35. (LC 371) Sum of Two Integers
    • 36. (LC 393) UTF-8 Validation
